meanings.sent1: I will prefill the water pitcher before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: Please prefill the gas tank before we start the road trip.
meanings.sent3: He decided to prefill the bird feeder to surprise the hungry sparrows.
meanings.sent4: The students were eager to prefill their notebooks with colorful drawings.
meanings.sent5: She always prefill the ice cube trays to have cold drinks ready.

meanings.definition: To complete a form or document with information before it is officially submitted
meanings.sent1: Remember to prefill your name and address on the registration form.
meanings.sent2: The secretary will prefill the paperwork to save time during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to prefill the adoption papers with paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The detective decided to prefill the suspect's statement to test their honesty.
meanings.sent5: It is common practice to prefill the medical history section of the patient form.
